name: ADVANCED SCREEN WRITING

values.comments:
This is a workshop-style course for students who have completed a screenwriting class, or have a draft of a screenplay they wish to improve. Classes consist of discussing students’ work, as well as discussing relevant themes of the movie business and examining classic films and why they work as well as they do.

Many students prized the “challenge” of writing a full screenplay, enjoyed reading each other’s work and found the semester to be an overall “joy.” Students mastered the ability to think more “critically about movies” and transitively “about problems in other fields of study.” 

Students called Professor Van Cleve “the best” and appeared to have enjoyed her teaching methods overall. Her teaching style perhaps made the class a bit “disorganized.” 

Freshmen are not admitted and a writing sample must be sent to the department for review. Students recommended this course to “most students.” Based on fewer than 8 comments.
